Package com.sync.db

Class SyncedData<T>

java.lang.Object
com.sync.db.SyncedData<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of data.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Syncable, Serializable
public class SyncedData<T> extends Object implements Syncable
A wrapper of variables (primitive or non-primitive) that is intended to be saved in database. For List and maps, please use SyncedList and SyncedMap
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SyncedData(T value)
    Creates a data variable with default value.

  • Constructor Details

    • SyncedData

      public SyncedData(T value)
      Creates a data variable with default value.
      Parameters:
      value - Default value of the variable.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public T get()
      Gets the value of the variables
      Returns:
      The actual value of the datatype.

    • set

      public void set(T value)
      Sets new value to the variable. This will not automatically update it in the database. You manually have to call SyncDB.commit() in order to save it to the database.
      Parameters:
      value - The new value to set.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Removes this variable from the database. After calling this, it will be no-more syncing with the database until it is updated or modified. You have to call SyncDB.commit() after calling this.

    • update

      public void update(T newValue)
      Sets the value of the datatype and then updates it in the database asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      newValue - The value to assign.
